Game

Class RandomFires

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.TimerTask
      • Game.RandomFires
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class RandomFires
extends java.util.TimerTask
    This class randomly displays fires at set locations on the passed in JFrame.

    Course Info:

    ICS4U0 with Ms. Krasteva
    Version:
    4.0 June 10, 2019

    Total time spent writing file: 5.5 hours

    Instance Variables:

    frame The JFrame on which the fires are to be displayed.

    itemsArray An ArrayList of JLabels storing the equipment that can be used to extinguish fire.

    background The JLabel used as the background for the JFrame.

    fire1 The fire at the first position from the left, displayed using a JLabel.

    fire2 The fire at the second position from the left, displayed using a JLabel.

    fire3 The fire at the third position from the left, displayed using a JLabel.

    fire4 The fire at the last position from the left, diplayed using a JLabel.

    activeFires The number of fires that are currently displayed.

    fireCount The number of fires that have been put out.

    Author:
    Rohan Krishna

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      RandomFires(javax.swing.JFrame window, javax.swing.JLabel image, java.util.ArrayList<javax.swing.JLabel> itemsArr)
      Initializes the JFrame on which to display fires, as well as the JLabel to store the background image and the ArrayList of equipment.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String alertWhenFinished()
      Returns whether level two has been lost or won depending on the fires put out and the fires currently active.
      void eraseFire(int x, int y, javax.swing.JLabel item)
      This method hides a fire upon the appropriate item being dragged over it to extinguish it.
      void run()
      This method is called at intervals that the TimerTask is scheduled to run.
      void startFire()

    • Constructor Detail

      • RandomFires

        public RandomFires(javax.swing.JFrame window,
                   javax.swing.JLabel image,
                   java.util.ArrayList<javax.swing.JLabel> itemsArr)
        Initializes the JFrame on which to display fires, as well as the JLabel to store the background image and the ArrayList of equipment.
        Parameters:
        window - The JFrame on which to display the fires.
        image - The JLabel used as the background of the JFrame.
        itemsArr - An ArrayList of JLabels which represent equipment to extinguish fires.

    • Method Detail

      • startFire

        public void startFire()
        This method displays a fire at one of four locations, choosen randomly.

        Local Variables:

        num Stores a random number from 0 - 9 to determine if and where to display a fire.

        fire The JLabel that is used to display a fire.

      • eraseFire

        public void eraseFire(int x,
                      int y,
                      javax.swing.JLabel item)
        This method hides a fire upon the appropriate item being dragged over it to extinguish it.
        Parameters:
        x - The x coordinate where the mouse is released to use the item.
        y - The y coordinate where the mouse is released to use the item.
        item - The JLabel representing an item to put out fire.

      • alertWhenFinished

        public java.lang.String alertWhenFinished()
        Returns whether level two has been lost or won depending on the fires put out and the fires currently active.
        Returns:
        "win" if 15 fires have been put out, "lose" if 4 fires are active.

      • run

        public void run()
        This method is called at intervals that the TimerTask is scheduled to run. A fire is created periodically.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
        Specified by:
        run in class java.util.TimerTask
